cyclone.name: ANA
cyclone.current_location: about 165 miles SSE of Myrtle Beach, South Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking north-northwest, then northwest, toward the South and North Carolina coasts
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the South Santee River–Cape Lookout stretch of the Carolinas coast

weather_observation.within_uncertainty_cone: Yes – on the southwestern edge of the cone
weather_observation.watch_coast: Edisto Beach SC to south of South Santee River SC (Tropical Storm Watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: South Santee River SC to Cape Lookout NC (Tropical Storm Warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeastern U.S. coastline from Georgia northward through the Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: Gusty easterly winds 25–35 mph possible as the storm passes to the east
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge generally below 2 ft possible on immediate Georgia coast
weather_observation.rainfall: Light to moderate rainfall 1–2 inches possible at the port
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents that could hamper vessel movements and small-craft operations
